text: This is what everyone's UI will look like on the Switch 2. We'll only be able to afford one game.
If the console was 399 and the games would be 69.99 i guarantee that the switch 2 would sell like hotcakes. They wouldn't be able to keep up with demand.

Honestly, the more I learn the less I want a switch 2. I am not happy, you know exactly why. This pricing is just retarded, it’s literally just impeding on the reach. Do you really need to relearn these lessons? You found out with the 3ds, having a child’s game be $90 is crazy.

The chat is brutal. Bundles are going to have to be $399 by Christmas, or this is going the way of the Wii U. 
"Great console, but complete failure in sales due to pricing."
"Nintendo prices themselves out of competition"
"Microsoft and Sony announce cloud gaming handhelds for

Greed is when the price inevitably increases due to inflation. The industry artificially maintained a $60 pricetag for decades, leading to companies introducing measures like microtransactions. Increasing the price is better than following other devs and their price models.
Looking forward to the game but not the new pricing.
